title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
lucaa left at 01:03 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
abusenius left at 02:29 (Quit: Konversation terminated!  
npm left at 04:37 (Remote host closed the connection  
npm joined #xwiki at 04:42  
rrodriguez left at 07:09 (Quit: rrodriguez  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 07:09  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:17  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:29  
vmassol left at 07:45 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:46  
rrodriguez left at 08:02 (Quit: rrodriguez  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:30  
silviar joined #xwiki at 08:48  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 08:57  
sburjan - (09:08): XAANNOTATIONS-32  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:08  
sburjan - (09:08): XAANNOTATIONS-32  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:17  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:17  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:19  
vmassol - (09:26): good morning team  
vmassol - (09:26): I'm finishing my link handling refactoring code today and I should be ready by EOD today  
vmassol - (09:26): which means we could release tomorrow morning IMO on my side  
vmassol - (09:27): tmortagne: gl with the new release ;)  
vmassol - (09:27): I hope it's the last one before long...  
tmortagne - (09:27): vmassol: me too...  
silviar left at 09:30 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan - (09:32): tmortagne: what has been decided in the weekend ? 2.4.3 , 2.4.2.1 what's the strategy ?  
tmortagne - (09:32): the one voted on the mailing list: 2.3.4  
tmortagne - (09:32): i'm sending summary mail  
tmortagne - (09:32): 2.4.3  
sburjan - (09:34): I'd say if you can wait till tomorrow or later today untill de official launch  
sburjan - (09:35): so I can test before sending again the "release news"  
tmortagne - (09:36): sburjan: that's what is planned (see the mail)  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:36  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:49  
sburjan - (09:51): tmortagne: does the latest snapshot of 2.4.2 built on 25 (saturday) contain the blocker fix I found ?  
tmortagne - (10:03): sburjan: you mean the parent field bug ?  
sburjan - (10:07): yes  
tmortagne - (10:07): this was fixed just after you found it  
sburjan - (10:07): okay.. I'm downloading the saturday snapshot to test it ..  
sburjan - (10:07): are there gonna be other commits on 2.4.3 ?  
tmortagne - (10:07): sburjan: just wait i'm finishing the 2.4.3 release to test before announcing  
tmortagne - (10:08): better test that  
sburjan - (10:08): okay. could you ping me when it's built and packeged .. so I can do a final test before official release ?  
tmortagne - (10:09): sburjan: here http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/2.4.3/  
tmortagne - (10:09): waiting for XEM to finish and i'm sending a mail to ask for other tests  
sburjan - (10:09): okay.. I'll wait for the mail  
tmortagne - (10:09): you can already test http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/2.4.3/  
sburjan - (10:11): ok  
mflorea - (10:14): tmortagne: I got this http://pastebin.com/LsjiBfxF when I started a fresh XE 2.5-SNAPSHOT (the latest I think)  
tmortagne - (10:20): mflorea: yes i know vmassol reported it to me already that's actually badly logged as error by the classpath "explorer" tool i'm using, it just mean it found some things in the classpatch that are not jars, i need to filter the classpath myself before giving it to reflexion tool to cleanup the log  
vmassol - (10:20): it would be great to fix it before the 2.5M2 release though  
mflorea - (10:21): ah, ok  
tmortagne - (10:21): vmassol: yes but i'm kind of doing something else right now  
vmassol - (10:21): ah? didn't notice ;)  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:33  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 10:57  
vmassol - (11:28): tmortagne: are you sure the svn externals are correct for 'tools/xem-web-debug-eclipse/"? They seem strange  
vmassol - (11:28): when I do a svn up I see externals for all dirs in there  
vmassol - (11:29): (I haven't checked the svn external def itself)  
tmortagne - (11:29): vmassol: yes they are correct an they seem stange because that's why i needed svn 1.6: relative externals on files and dirs  
vmassol - (11:29): btw svn up takes forever for me now  
tmortagne - (11:30): maybe the first time  
vmassol - (11:30): nope  
vmassol - (11:30): I did it several times already  
tmortagne - (11:30): it's pretty quick for me and fabio said it was ok too  
tmortagne - (11:30): and i guess others are using it too  
vmassol - (11:42): big commit coming, crossing fingers…. 155 files modified :)  
silviar left at 11:44 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (11:49): mflorea: good morning… I'll need your help to review the changes I've made in the wysiwyg and to fix them...  
vmassol - (11:49): fix them = make the wysiwyg work with 2.1 syntax + handle all link types  
vmassol - (11:49): (I saw it was only supporting 3 link types)  
mflorea - (11:50): vmassol: ok, is this for 2.5M2?  
vmassol - (11:50): yes :)  
vmassol - (11:51): but if the wyswyg doesn't work for xwiki syntax 2.1 in 2.5M2 it's ok  
vmassol - (11:51): it needs to work as before as a minimum  
mflorea - (11:51): ok  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:53  
lucaa left at 11:54 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
sburjan - (11:57): do we have a release date for 2.5M2 ?  
sdumitriu - (11:58): This week  
sdumitriu - (11:58): I'll send a vote/status request mail  
sburjan - (11:58): I saw you fixed some bugs I reported  
vmassol - (11:58): it's supposed to be today  
vmassol - (11:58): (not this week! :))  
sburjan - (11:59): no no .. shouldn't we finish with 2.4.3 first ? :)  
vmassol - (11:59): I'm doing some manual tests on my last commit but I'll be ready this afternoon, not too late I think  
vmassol - (11:59): sdumitriu: yes we need a status  
vmassol - (11:59): jvdrean: what's your status re user directory?  
vmassol - (12:00): sdumitriu: same for "send this page" by mail. Any other stuff pending for M2?  
sdumitriu - (12:00): vmassol: Yes, today, but there are some things in progress (csrf for example)  
vmassol - (12:00): sdumitriu:  
vmassol - (12:00): re csrf, is it breaking anything?  
sdumitriu - (12:01): It breaks some non-xe applications  
sdumitriu - (12:02): And the XE "should" work, but it needs thorough testing  
vmassol - (12:02): how do we make non XE app work?  
sdumitriu - (12:02): sburjan: When can you test it? I guess you'll have 2.4.3 also  
sburjan - (12:03): well I am testing 2.4.3 as we speak  
sdumitriu - (12:03): Well, download them from code.xwiki.org, see if the work, if not fix them, upload them  
sburjan - (12:03): but everything is fine .. it seems  
vmassol - (12:03): sdumitriu: ouch so we're breaking anything who has an XE app?  
vmassol - (12:03): s/anything/anyone/  
vmassol - (12:03): is the info in the release notes about what needs to be fixed?  
sdumitriu - (12:04): Not everything  
sdumitriu - (12:04): Things that use the default inline mode should work  
sdumitriu - (12:04): But when custom pseudo-inline editing is used, it breaks  
sdumitriu - (12:05): Like calling /save/ manually from a script (AJAX), or custom <form> elements  
vmassol - (12:05): sdumitriu: csrf is off by default right?  
sdumitriu - (12:05): I don't think so, let me check  
sdumitriu - (12:06): No, it's always on  
jvdrean - (12:24): vmassol: re user directory status, I have one but it uses the new module for which there's no consensus  
vmassol - (12:26): there is no consensus ?  
vmassol - (12:26): I thought there was  
vmassol - (12:27): btw why don't you make it internal for now, inside xwiki-core for ex?  
vmassol - (12:28): actually as I've said I'm also ok as a new module  
jvdrean - (12:28): well I don't think it is ok to commit it if you think it is flawed  
vmassol - (12:29): as you want but what's important is that the user directory is there for 2.5M2  
sdumitriu - (12:32): Alternatively, we can commit Raluca's patches from http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-432 and refactor them in 2.6 to use the new user module  
vmassol - (12:35): sdumitriu: btw I still don't like the underline for links....  
vmassol - (12:36): we need a stylesheet for wcag anyway  
vmassol - (12:36): for better color difference depending on the person, etc  
sdumitriu - (12:36): So, should I revert that?  
vmassol - (12:36): IMO yes and we should provide a different style sheet  
sdumitriu - (12:37): Hm, indeed, I just got an idea, thanks  
vmassol - (12:38): sdumitriu: are you sending the status email? (with your own status!!)  
sdumitriu - (12:38): Yes  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 12:56  
flaviusolaru left at 13:10 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea left at 13:18 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (13:19): sdumitriu: is it "normal" that the Add button is still larger than the menu bar?  
sdumitriu - (13:19): No  
vmassol - (13:19): I thought we agreed that the button would be the same height  
sdumitriu - (13:20): Are you sure you have the right build?  
vmassol - (13:20): right now it's one or 2 pixels larger for me  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 13:20  
vmassol - (13:20): yes  
vmassol - (13:20): built from trunk  
vmassol - (13:20): but  
vmassol - (13:20): I'm on chrome  
vmassol - (13:20): maybe that's the reason  
sdumitriu - (13:20): Shouldn't be  
sdumitriu - (13:20): I blame DPI  
sdumitriu - (13:21): Yes, if I reduce the font size it overflows here as well  
sdumitriu - (13:21): (only in Chrome)  
vmassol - (13:21): just tested on FF  
vmassol - (13:21): it's even worse than on chrome  
vmassol - (13:21): overflow by more pixels  
vmassol - (13:21): \*overflows  
sburjan - (13:21): vmassol: the add button is same height as the bar.. since 3 weeks ago  
vmassol - (13:21): sburjan: nope  
sdumitriu - (13:21): vmassol: Cache refresh?  
vmassol - (13:22): I tried  
sdumitriu - (13:22): I think it's a rounding error somewhere  
vmassol - (13:22): sdumitriu: re FF you're right  
sburjan - (13:22): vmassol: do you have a mac ?  
vmassol - (13:22): it was cache refresh  
vmassol - (13:22): on chrome it's not cache  
vmassol - (13:23): on FF it's ok, no overflows  
sburjan - (13:23): so it's a Chrome thing  
silviar joined #xwiki at 13:23  
sdumitriu - (13:23): If I press Ctrl- several times, it goes back to the right size  
sdumitriu - (13:24): Then, as I Ctrl+, it overflows 1px, then back to perfect fit, then 1px smaller  
sburjan - (13:24): silviar: uses chrome too, but on windows .. and she's on win  
sdumitriu - (13:24): vmassol: Same for you?  
vmassol - (13:25): if I ctrl + twice it's ok  
vmassol - (13:25): wait  
vmassol - (13:25): once is enough  
vmassol - (13:25): so the default overflows by 1px  
vmassol - (13:26): then ctrl + makes it good  
sdumitriu - (13:26): Default on your DPI  
lpereira left at 13:26 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (13:26): Mac DPI  
sdumitriu - (13:26): sburjan: On Windows it's OK with the default zoom, right?  
sdumitriu - (13:26): silviar  
sdumitriu - (13:27): On my machine it looks good with the default zoom  
silviar - (13:28): looks good on default; looks bad on Ctrl - & Ctrl + +  
silviar - (13:28): +/- 1 px  
vmassol - (13:28): tmortagne: the conversion between syntax is not automatic? I need to check why I don't get the alert box when switching from 2.0 to 2.1  
vmassol - (13:29): maybe there's a hardcoded check  
vmassol - (13:29): do you remember where this is coded?  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 13:29  
sburjan - (13:31): sdumitriu , vmassol : is it normal to get some console errors when trying to export the WebHome  of Main space as PDF ?  
sdumitriu - (13:31): "yes"  
sburjan - (13:32): ok  
sburjan - (13:33): why the quotes ?  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:34  
sburjan - (13:35): tmortagne: 2.4.3 seems ok.  
vmassol - (13:36): sdumitriu: I have a pb in edit mode for the content field on chrome: http://tinycoke.com/\_6rKQAmm7POcgw/screen\_shot\_2010-09-27\_at\_1.35.30\_pm.png  
sdumitriu - (13:36): It's normal, but it's not OK  
sdumitriu - (13:36): Those should be fixed at some point, but they've been there forever, they're mostly harmless  
sburjan - (13:36): yeah ..  
sdumitriu - (13:37): vmassol: Works well for me  
vmassol - (13:37): it  used to work well before for me too  
sdumitriu - (13:37): The toolbar is supposed to be there  
vmassol - (13:38): hmmm  
sdumitriu - (13:38): Always?  
vmassol - (13:38): must be related to the syntax  
sdumitriu - (13:38): Ah, right  
vmassol - (13:38): since it's ok in xwiki syntax 2.0  
vmassol - (13:38): but not in 2.1  
sdumitriu - (13:38): The toolbar checks for 1.0 or 2.0  
vmassol - (13:38): might be hardcoded somewhere  
sdumitriu - (13:38): It is  
sburjan - (13:40): any idea if the proposals Caty created (Menus for the Admin sections) are gonna be inclluded in 2.5 final ?  
sburjan - (13:40): or they are planned for 2.6  
sburjan - (13:42): 2010-09-27 14:40:56,092 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/get/XWiki/Admin?xpage=xpart&vm=commentsinline.vm] INFO  internal.DefaultCSRFToken       - CSRFToken: Anti-CSRF secret token component has been initialized .. this is form abusenius' commit ?  
abusenius - (13:42): yep, I'll change it to debug  
vmassol - (13:42): this should be debug IMO  
vmassol - (13:42): yep  
sburjan - (13:44): do you need an issue for this ?  
abusenius - (13:45): probably not, it is purely cosmetic  
sburjan - (13:45): okay.  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 13:45  
sburjan - (13:45): just don't forget to commit it :)  
vmassol - (13:51): abusenius: why add a 2.5 branch?  
vmassol - (13:51): 2.5 is trunk  
vmassol - (13:52): (I've replied by mail)  
lucaa left at 13:53 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
abusenius - (13:59): ah, sorry, I meant 2.4  
vmassol - (13:59): abusenius: I don't think you need to systematically add a 2.4 branch either  
vmassol - (13:59): it's only for apps that need to be re-released with 2.4  
abusenius - (14:00): is there a list of them somewhere?  
vmassol - (14:00): it's probably up to the RM to do that when needed  
vmassol - (14:00): tmortagne: wdyt?  
abusenius - (14:00): btw, the person who will release 2.4.4 will have to remember to take the versions from the branch  
sburjan - (14:02): sdumitriu, vmassol : any idea how can I create a XWiki synthax 1.0 page ? AFAIK the createPage() method from UI-test creates 2.0 pages by default, and I need one in 1.0 for a test  
sdumitriu - (14:03): Create it in 2.0, open edit mode, change the syntax  
sdumitriu - (14:03): Save  
sburjan - (14:03): okay.. then I'll have to implement the PageObject for that Panel  
sburjan - (14:05): any idea if I mix 1.0 with 2.0 synthax on a page ? the the page is set to 2.0, the 1.0 content is not rendered ?  
sburjan - (14:05): or both rendered ?  
vmassol - (14:05): sburjan: if there's no way to create in synatx 1.0 then you need to modify the ui tests fwk  
sburjan - (14:06): well, sdumitriu said there is no other way .. it seems that programatically you can't create a 1.0 page  
vmassol - (14:06): hmmm thinking about it, we don't have a way for a user  
vmassol - (14:06): you can  
vmassol - (14:06): programatically  
vmassol - (14:06): but this is about user tests  
sburjan - (14:06): yes, by editing the panel  
flaviusolaru left at 14:06 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan - (14:06): and selecting 1.0  
sburjan - (14:07): but we don;'t have anything like CreatePage cp = new Create Page("1.0");  
vmassol - (14:07): yes this is the correct way  
vmassol - (14:07): we do programatically but that's aother story  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 14:07  
sburjan - (14:07): okay .. I was just figuring that we had an method that handles this within the constructor  
sburjan - (14:07): with no more Ui interaction forthis  
sburjan - (14:08): thanks :)  
sdumitriu - (14:08): I think you can do it with an URL parameter  
sburjan - (14:09): ah no, i don't want something complicated. I just wan a 1.0 page with a paragraph in it .. so I can test that annotations won't work  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 14:09  
abusenius - (14:16): sdumitriu, vmassol, so you propose to just commit app changes on trunk and let the next RM remember that he has to branch?  
venkatesh left at 14:17 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
vmassol - (14:17): abusenius: actually we can do a bit better I think  
vmassol - (14:17): by modifying the POM and using a version range for the xwiki-core dependency  
vmassol - (14:17): a runtime dep with a version range  
vmassol - (14:17): to show the compatibility  
vmassol - (14:18): we should do that for all extensions not package in the platform probably  
vmassol - (14:18): forget that last line  
abusenius - (14:18): ok, that would do it too  
vmassol - (14:18): we should do that for all modules having a separate release cycle (ie a different versioning shceme)  
abusenius - (14:19): is't there some script helping to do the release?  
abusenius - (14:19): (it would need to be updated)  
vmassol - (14:20): IMO version range is really the best way  
vmassol - (14:20): and we'll need to use it anyway in the future for our extension manager  
abusenius - (14:21): but then fixing bugs on 2.4 branch would mean releasing something like admin-app-1.36.1, right?  
abusenius - (14:21): (assuming 2.5 uses 1.37)  
tmortagne - (14:21): abusenius: yes  
abusenius - (14:23): (on a side note, I'd be +100 on synchronizing all versions in kde-style)  
tmortagne - (14:23): vmassol: yes the syntax conversion between syntax is supposed to be automatic nothing is supposed to be hardcoded, maybe there is a bug  
sburjan - (14:36): so there is no hybrid synthax  
sburjan - (14:36): :)  
vmassol - (14:40): mflorea: I forgot to commit my change for the wyswiyg editor....  
vmassol - (14:40): committing now  
tmortagne - (14:41): vmassol: are you sure the xwiki/2.1 renderer is properly registered ? that would explain why it did not converted anything  
vmassol - (14:42): mflorea: committed  
mflorea - (14:42): vmassol: ok, I'll take a look later, after I finish with office preview  
vmassol - (14:42): tmortagne: yes it is, I can use it  
vmassol - (14:43): tmortagne: do you know where the check is? in the information panel only?  
tmortagne - (14:43): yes it's all in JS coming with the information panel  
tmortagne - (14:43): is a JS extension i think  
tmortagne - (14:44): s/is/in/  
vmassol - (14:45): tmortagne: btw I introduced a qualifier field in the Syntax class without discussing it, I hope you're ok with it ….. :)  
tmortagne - (14:45): did not reviewed your commit yet  
sburjan left at 14:49 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
Denis joined #xwiki at 14:55  
vmassol - (14:57): tmortagne: I can't find any js. Any idea?  
asrfel left at 14:57 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (14:58): vmassol: did you looks in objects ? it's supposed to be a JavaScriptExtension  
vmassol - (14:58): ah didn't check there  
vmassol - (14:58): checking  
tmortagne - (14:58): i know  
tmortagne - (14:58): the list is actually harcoded it seems  
tmortagne - (14:58): the list of valid syntaxes  
vmassol - (14:59): yep  
tmortagne - (14:59): which is wrong, any syntax with a renderer should be valid  
vmassol - (14:59): cannot we use velocity to generate it?  
tmortagne - (14:59): i think we can use velocity in jsextensions  
vmassol - (15:00): we can  
tmortagne - (15:00): (i did not coded this part in fact)  
vmassol - (15:01): tmortagne: is it XWiki.getAvailableRendererSyntax?  
tmortagne - (15:01): vmassol: i think you added a service for it some time ago  
vmassol - (15:01): yes but that's for the avail syntaxes  
vmassol - (15:02): not the ones for which there's a renderer  
vmassol - (15:02): well we could add it  
tmortagne - (15:02): available syntaxes does not mean anything, you mean available parsers ?  
vmassol - (15:02): since it doesn't have much to do with XWiki class  
vmassol - (15:02): yes it's called getAvailableParserSyntaxes()  
tmortagne - (15:03): the there should be the renderer one  
tmortagne - (15:03): s/the/then/  
vmassol - (15:03): yep  
vmassol - (15:04): testing on availability of PrintRendererFactory ?  
vmassol - (15:05): answer: yes  
tmortagne - (15:05): yes i think since that's what we use in XWiki  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 15:15  
vmassol - (15:20): sdumitriu: just found that the hierarchy is printed now, cool  
vmassol - (15:21): (I had tried a few days ago and it wasn't printed)  
sdumitriu - (15:21): It is, except on the main page where it shouldn't be visible  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 15:25  
vmassol - (15:31): hmm js experts: shouldn't I be able to see the js injected by a $jsx.use(…) when I view source in my browser?  
tmortagne - (15:32): vmassol: nop jsextension are linked, not inserted  
tmortagne - (15:34): but you can see the result by using the same link you can find in the head  
vmassol - (15:34): right, trying to find the link  
tmortagne - (15:34): (don't remember exactly the format)  
vmassol - (15:34): found it thanks  
tmortagne - (15:36): np  
vmassol - (15:38): tmortagne: actually the conversion feature seems broken  
vmassol - (15:38): I don't get it either when converting from syntax 1.0 to 2.0  
tmortagne - (15:38): should be pretty recent since it's working in 2.4  
tmortagne - (15:38): did not checked in 2.4.3pre  
tmortagne - (15:39): would have been nice to upgrade myxwiki.org to 2.5M1  
vmassol - (15:48): tmortagne: ok I'm ready to commit my changes to support any syntaxes in the conversion but this means the panels app will require core 2.5M2…. ok?  
tmortagne - (15:49): vmassol: panels app is already not compatible with 2.4  
tmortagne - (15:49): that's the cause of 2.4.3 ;)  
tmortagne - (15:52): vmassol: syntax conversion is working well in 2.4.3 so that's a trunk specific bug  
tmortagne - (15:53): (cf "actually the conversion feature seems broken")  
vmassol - (15:53): tmortagne: can you reproduce too?  
tmortagne - (15:53): i checked on 2.4.3  
tmortagne - (15:54): i will try but i need to finish review your commit first ;)  
tmortagne - (15:54): anyway if you fix it right now it's ok  
vmassol - (15:55): hmm trying to add a runtime dep to the panels module but not working right now for some reason  
vmassol - (15:56): I get http://tinypaste.com/826a5  
vmassol - (15:56): (if you have any idea....)  
flaviusolaru - (15:57): hi all, quick question: have we modified escapetool? it is generating me a {{\/html}} at the end  
vmassol - (15:57): ah I know  
vmassol - (15:57): it must be because of SNAPSHOT

jbrBridge - (22:02): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Try going to xwiki/bin/edit/YourSpace/WebPreferences?editor=object  
jbrBridge - (22:03): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Then expand the section that says "Objects of type XWiki.XWikiPreferences (1)" and find where is says "Color theme"  
jbrBridge - (22:07): [CalebJamesDeLisle] It's possible that there will not be any objects in xwiki/bin/edit/YourSpace/WebPreferences?editor=object, if so just ask and I'll tell how to make the WebPreferences get created.
